Jejak Rekam Shin Tae-yong, Kandidat Pelatih Timnas Indonesia Pilihan Ketum PSSI Iwan Bule
03 Nov 2019, 22:59 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Nama pelatih asal Korea Selatan, Shin Tae-yong, dimunculkan oleh Ketua Umum PSSI baru yakni Mochamad Iriawan alias Iwan Bule sebagai kandidat pelatih Timnas Indonesia yang baru.
Iwan Bule bergerak cepat setelah terpilih sebagai Ketua Umum PSSI periode 2019-2023. langsung memunculkan dua nama pelatih asing untuk membesut Timnas Indonesia, menggantikan Simon McMenemy.
Iwan Bule menuturkan akan mengevaluasi kinerja Simon McMenemy dari jabatannya sebagai pelatih Timnas Indonesia dalam satu-dua hari ini. Ada indikasi, pelatih asal Skotlandia itu akan digantikan pelatih lain.
Pelatih asing yang disiapkan Iwan Bule adalah Luis Milla dan Shin Tae-yong. Nama terakhir mungkin terdengar asing karena belum pernah berkarier di sepak bola Indonesia.
Namun, di dunia sepak bola internasional, Shin Tae-yong sudah cukup familiar. Pria berusia 49 tahun itu merupakan mantan pelatih Timnas Korea Selatan pada Piala Dunia 2018.
Namun, karier Shin Tae-yong bersama Taegeuk Warriors tak berlangsung lama. Timnas Korea Selatan asuhannya hanya meraih sekali kemenangan dan menelan dua kali kekalahan, yang membuat mereka terhenti di babak penyisihan grup.
Meski demikian, kualitas Shin Tae-yong tentu tak perlu diragukan lagi. Pada 2016, ia hampir membawa Timnas Korea Selatan menjadi juara Piala AFC U-23.
Ketika itu, Timnas Korea Selatan U-23 kalah 2-3 dari Jepang. Secara keseluruhan, penampilan Korea Selatan cukup apik di Piala AFC U-23 2016, yakni meraih empat kemenangan, sekali imbang, dan sekali kalah. Tim asuhannya juga menceploskan 14 gol dan hanya kemasukan enam gol.Selain itu, Shin Tae-yong juga pernah mengantar Timnas Korea Selatan U-23 melaju sampai perempat final Olimpiade Rio 2016. Kemudian pada 2017, Shin Tae-yong juga berhasil mengantarkan Timnas Korea Selatan U-20 melaju sampai babak 16 besar Piala Dunia U-20 2017.
Jejak rekam yang cukup bagus itu membuat Shin Tae-yong pantas diberi kesempatan menukangi Timnas Indonesia. Ia akan mencatatkan diri sebagai pelatih asal Asia pertama di skuat Merah Putih jika memang ditunjuk menggantikan Simon McMenemy.

Shin Tae-yong's Record Record, Candidate of Indonesian National Team Choices by PSSI Chairman, Iwan Bule
Nov 03 2019, 22:59 by Bola.net
Bola.net - The name of the South Korean trainer, Shin Tae-yong, was raised by the new PSSI General Chairman Mochamad Iriawan alias Iwan Bule as the new Indonesian national team coach candidate.
Iwan Bule moved quickly after being elected as General Chair of PSSI 2019-2023. immediately raised two names of foreign coaches to gush the Indonesian national team, replacing Simon McMenemy.
Iwan Bule said he would evaluate the performance of Simon McMenemy from his position as Indonesian national team coach in a day or two. There are indications that the Scottish coach will be replaced by another coach.
The foreign coaches prepared by Iwan Bule are Luis Milla and Shin Tae-yong. The last name may sound foreign because it has never been a career in Indonesian football.
However, in the world of international soccer, Shin Tae-yong is quite familiar. The 49-year-old man was a former South Korean national team coach at the 2018 World Cup.
However, Shin Tae-yong's career with Taegeuk Warriors did not last long. His South Korea national team won only one win and swallowed two defeats, which stopped them in the group stage.
Even so, Shin Tae-yong's qualities certainly don't need to be doubted. In 2016, he almost brought the South Korean national team to win the AFC U-23 Cup.
At that time, South Korea U-23 national team lost 2-3 to Japan. Overall, South Korea's performance was quite neat in the 2016 AFC U-23 Cup, which won four wins, one draw, and one defeat. His care team also scored 14 goals and only conceded six goals. In addition, Shin Tae-yong also drove the South Korea U-23 national team to advance to the quarter-finals of the 2016 Rio Olympics. Then in 2017, Shin Tae-yong also managed to deliver the South Korean National Team U-20 advanced to the last 16 of the 2017 U-20 World Cup.
The pretty good track record makes Shin Tae-yong deserve to be given the opportunity to coach the Indonesian national team. He will register as the first Asian coach in the Red and White squad if it is appointed to replace Simon McMenemy.
